腸

Значения

Внутренности, кишки

Мнемоника

Органы 月, похожие на солнечные лучи 昜.

Варианты

肠, 膓

heisig_chinese_memo: Intestines are a part of the pig's body which some people find tasty and could eat any day of the week. &nbsp
heisig_constituent: intestines, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, piggy bank, sun, day, piglets
myStory:
it's not (勿) dawn (旦) but it's glorious

Pictogram (象形) – blood on a knife; the original character of 刎 (OC *mɯnʔ, “to cut”). Phonetically borrowed for the negative particle since the time of the oracle bone script.
koohiiStory1: Intestines are the part of the body that is taken out of piglets to make piggy banks. Just imagine factory workers scraping out the intestines of real piglets and packaging them up for little children.
koohiiStory2: Taking things too literally, you used a real piglet as a piggy bank. Now when you smash it open to get your coins out, you have to dig out your coins from its intestines. ew.
jp_example_words: 腸(ちょう): guts, bowels, intestines
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The moon is easy tonight, so you decide to cut it open. But, the moon wasn't the moon, it was your big, pale, round tummy. You just cut it open, and now you can see your intestines.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine the moon, then imagine it cross-fading into your big, round tummy. Then, cut it open because you think the moon is easy to cut. And finally, see your intestines as clearly as you can.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: All over the world, people are cutting their bellies open, because they think its an easy moon (versus a normal moon, or hard moon, presumably). This is because they have fallen victim to a spell by Mrs. Chou (ちょう).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: This scene was in all the omen radicals you've been seeing about her. If only you could have stopped her, then none of this would have happened, right? Perhaps it was all destiny, you think, as your intestines fall from your stomach and Mrs. Chou cackles over your weakening body.

Kanshudo_mnemonic: the glorious (昜) body part (⺼) is the intestines
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The tastiest part of the piglet body for the Chinese is the intestines.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " meat " and "昜", the original meaning is one of the digestive organs of humans and animals. "Shuowen": "The large and small intestines. From the flesh, the sound." "Suwen‧ Linglan Secret Code": "The large intestine, the official of the preacher, changes out; the small intestine, the official who is prosperous, the out Yan." Sima Qian of the Han Dynasty "Report to Ren Shaoqing": "It takes the intestines one day and nine times. If you live, you will suddenly die. If you leave, you don't know where you are going." Cao Cao "Haoli Xing": "Sheng Min Bai Yi Yi , Nianzhi is heartbroken." The script " intestine " in silk and bamboo is also used as the original meaning, such as "Mawangdui. "Health Prescription" Line 161: "After taking a hundred days, there will be no (no) disease in the intestine." "Mawangdui. Line 229 of the Book of Strategists in the Warring States Period: "Qin used the way of sitting on the intestines of the sheep with a strong crossbow, and then went to the ground, and he took the shao (Zhao) as a great enemy."

The ancients also believed that " intestine " governs emotions, so " intestine " can be extended to heart and emotion. For example, "Historical Records: The Biography of Uncle Zhang of Wanshi": "He believed that he was incorruptible, and he was loyal and indifferent, but he worshiped Wan as the Taifu of the King of Hejian." Three Kingdoms Wei Jikang "The Book of Breaking Diplomacy with Shan Juyuan": "The intestines are sick and evil. To put it bluntly, you can send it out when you happen to happen." Bai Juyi of the Tang Dynasty, "Remembering the Trip to the Fourth Floor": "The turmoil has not been seen for three years, and the letters are hard to pass thousands of miles."

Animal intestines can be made into food. For example, the small intestine of pigs is filled with minced meat and condiments. It is made with rice milk and other seasonings, and foods shaped like intestines are called rice rolls.
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " meat " and "昜", the original meaning is one of the digestive organs of humans and animals.
humanum_full_description:
從「肉」，「昜」聲，本義為人與動物的消化器官之一。《說文》：「大小腸也。从肉，昜聲。」《素問‧靈蘭秘典論》：「大腸者，傳道之官，變化出焉；小腸者，受盛之官，化物出焉。」漢代司馬遷〈報任少卿書〉：「是以腸一日而九迴，居則忽忽若有所亡，出則不知其所往。」曹操〈蒿裡行〉：「生民百遺一，念之斷人腸」。簡帛文字「腸」也用作本義，如《馬王堆．養生方》第161行：「服之百日，令腸中毋（無）病。」《馬王堆．戰國縱橫家書》第229行：「秦以強弩坐羊腸之道，則地去可也，以與勺（趙）為大仇可也。」

　　古人亦以為「腸」主感情，故「腸」可引申為內心、感情。如《史記‧萬石張叔列傳》：「上以為廉，忠實無他腸，乃拜綰為河間王太傅。」三國魏嵇康〈與山巨源絕交書〉：「剛腸疾惡，輕肆直言，遇事便發，此甚不可二也。」唐代白居易〈登四樓憶行簡〉：「風波不見三年面，書信難傳萬里腸」。

　　動物的腸可製成食品，如用豬的小腸裝上碎肉和作料等製成者稱香腸、臘腸。用米漿與其他調料製作而成，形狀如腸的食品則稱腸粉。
humanum_short_description: 從「肉」，「昜」聲，本義為人與動物的消化器官之一。

腸(ちょう): guts, bowels, intestines

從「 肉 」，「 昜 」聲，本義為人與動物的消化器官之一。《說文》：「大小腸也。从肉，昜聲。」《素問‧靈蘭秘典論》：「大腸者，傳道之官，變化出焉；小腸者，受盛之官，化物出焉。」漢代司馬遷〈報任少卿書〉：「是以腸一日而九迴，居則忽忽若有所亡，出則不知其所往。」曹操〈蒿裡行〉：「生民百遺一，念之斷人腸」。簡帛文字「 腸 」也用作本義，如《馬王堆．養生方》第161行：「服之百日，令腸中毋（無）病。」《馬王堆．戰國縱橫家書》第229行：「秦以強弩坐羊腸之道，則地去可也，以與勺（趙）為大仇可也。」 古人亦以為「 腸 」主感情，故「 腸 」可引申為內心、感情。如《史記‧萬石張叔列傳》：「上以為廉，忠實無他腸，乃拜綰為河間王太傅。」三國魏嵇康〈與山巨源絕交書〉：「剛腸疾惡，輕肆直言，遇事便發，此甚不可二也。」唐代白居易〈登四樓憶行簡〉：「風波不見三年面，書信難傳萬里腸」。 動物的腸可製成食品，如用豬的小腸裝上碎肉和作料等製成者稱香腸、臘腸。用米漿與其他調料製作而成，形狀如腸的食品則稱腸粉。
From the sound of " meat" and " 昜", the original meaning is one of the digestive organs of humans and animals. "Shuowen": "The large and small intestines. From the flesh, the sound." "Suwen‧ Linglan Secret Code": "The large intestine, the official of the preacher, changes out; the small intestine, the official who is prosperous, the out Yan." Sima Qian of the Han Dynasty "Report to Ren Shaoqing": "It takes the intestines one day and nine times. If you live, you will suddenly die. If you leave, you don't know where you are going." Cao Cao "Haoli Xing": "Sheng Min Bai Yi Yi , Nianzhi is heartbroken." The script " intestine" in silk and bamboo is also used as the original meaning, such as "Mawangdui. "Health Prescription" Line 161: "After taking a hundred days, there will be no (no) disease in the intestine." "Mawangdui. Line 229 of the Book of Strategists in the Warring States Period: "Qin used the way of sitting on the intestines of the sheep with a strong crossbow, and then went to the ground, and he took the shao (Zhao) as a great enemy." The ancients also believed that " intestine" governs emotions, so " intestine" can be extended to heart and emotion. For example, "Historical Records: The Biography of Uncle Zhang of Wanshi": "He believed that he was incorruptible, and he was loyal and indifferent, but he worshiped Wan as the Taifu of the King of Hejian." Three Kingdoms Wei Jikang "The Book of Breaking Diplomacy with Shan Juyuan": "The intestines are sick and evil. To put it bluntly, you can send it out when you happen to happen." Bai Juyi of the Tang Dynasty, "Remembering the Trip to the Fourth Floor": "The turmoil has not been seen for three years, and the letters are hard to pass thousands of miles." Animal intestines can be made into food. For example, the small intestine of pigs is filled with minced meat and condiments. It is made with rice milk and other seasonings, and foods shaped like intestines are called rice rolls.

腸字的基本解释

腸
cháng
见“肠”。

腸字的汉语字典释义

[①]［cháng］
［《廣韻》直良切，平陽，澄。］
“肠1”的繁体字。亦作“脹2”。亦作“膓1”。
(1)消化器官的一部分。状如管子，上端连胃，下通肛门，分小肠和大肠两部分。
(2)内心；情怀。
(3)用动物的肠制成的食品。如用猪的小肠装上碎肉和作料等制成者称香肠。

腸字的康熙字典解释

【未集下】【肉字部】　腸； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页990第01
【唐韻】直良切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】仲良切，?音長。【說文】大小腸，藏府之二名也。【正字通】大腸長二丈一尺，廣四寸，徑一寸，當臍右迴疊十六曲，盛穀一斗，水七升半。小腸長三丈二尺，廣二寸半，徑八分分之少半，左迴疊積十六曲，容穀二斗四升，水六升三合。【白虎通】大腸，小腸，心肺府也。腸爲心肺主，心爲皮體主，故爲兩府也。【詩·大雅】自有肺腸。【書·盤庚】今予其敷心腹腎腸，歷告爾百姓于朕志。　又【釋名】暢也，言通暢胃氣也。　又【博雅】詳也。　又羊腸，太行山坂名。【戰國策】趙聞之起兵臨羊腸。【史記·趙世家】羊腸之西。【註】太行山坂通名。南屬懷州，北屬澤州。　又無腸，國名。【山海經】無腸之國，在深目東，其爲人長而無腸。　又馬腸，獸名。【山海經】讙舉之山，雒水出焉，其中多馬腸之物。【註】馬腸，人面虎身，音如嬰兒。　又魚腸，劒名。見【三國蜀志】。　又草名。【博雅】鹿腸，?蔘也。【又】馬腸，亦草名，葉似桑。見【山海經·讙舉之出註】。　又黃腸，槨名。【後漢·梁商傳】

腸字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
腸字的起名意思

暂无。

intestinal
Basic explanation of words
intestinal
cháng
See "intestine".
intestinal
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［cháng］
["Guangyun" Zhiliang cut, Pingyang, Cheng. ]
Traditional characters for "肠1". Also known as "Expansion 2". Also known as "膓1".
(1) A part of the digestive organs. It is shaped like a tube, connected to the stomach at the upper end and through the anus at the lower end. It is divided into two parts, the small intestine and the large intestine.
(2) Heart; feelings.
(3) Food made from animal intestines. Such as the small intestines of pigs filled with minced meat and condiments are called sausages.
intestinal
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Not set next] [Department of meat characters] 　 Chang; Kangxi strokes: 15; Page number: page 990 01
[Tang Yun] Zhi Liang cut [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Zheng Yun] Zhong Liang cut, long sound. [Said the text] Large intestines, the second name in Tibetan residence. [Zhengzitong] The large intestine is two feet and one foot long, four inches wide, and one inch in diameter. The small intestine is three feet and two feet long, two and a half inches wide, less than one-eighth of a diameter, with sixteen bends on the left gyrus, two buckets for four liters of capacity, and three liters of water for six liters. 【Baihutong】Large intestine, small intestine, heart and lungs. The intestine is the master of the heart and lungs, and the heart is the master of the skin and body, so it is the two residences. 【Poetry·Daya】It has its own lungs and intestines. [Shu·Pangeng] Today, I give it to his heart, stomach, and kidneys, and tell the people of Seoul to Zhenzhi.　 [Release name] Chang Ye, the speech is smooth and the stomach is qi.　[Bo Ya] again.　Yangchang, the name of Taihang Mountain. [Warring States Policy] Zhao Wenzhi raised his army to the sheep's intestines. [Historical Records·Zhao Family] West of the sheep intestines. [Note] The common name of Taihang Mountain. Huaizhou belongs to the south and Zezhou to the north.　Intestines again, the name of the country. [Shanhaijing] A country without intestines, in the east of Shenmu, it is long and without intestines.　Horse intestine, animal name. [Shan Hai Jing] The mountain of Juju, Luoshui flows out of Yan, among which the things of Thomas' intestines. [Note] Horse intestine, human face and tiger body, sound like a baby.　Fish intestines, 劒名. See [Three Kingdoms Shu Zhi].　Also cursive name. [Bo Ya] Deer intestines, ginseng. 【Also】Horse intestine, also grass name, leaves like mulberry. See【Shanhaijing·Notes on the Outstanding of the Citations】.　Yellow intestine, name. [Later Han·Liang Shang Biography]

Name meaning

cháng
intestines; emotions; sausage
Radicals: 月, 易  (moon, easy)
Meaning Mnemonic
The moon is easy tonight, so you decide to cut it open. But, the moon wasn't the moon, it was your big, pale, round tummy. You just cut it open, and now you can see your intestines.
Imagine the moon, then imagine it cross-fading into your big, round tummy. Then, cut it open because you think the moon is easy to cut. And finally, see your intestines as clearly as you can.
Reading Mnemonic
All over the world, people are cutting their bellies open, because they think its an easy moon (versus a normal moon, or hard moon, presumably). This is because they have fallen victim to a spell by Mrs. Chou (ちょう).
This scene was in all the omen radicals you've been seeing about her. If only you could have stopped her, then none of this would have happened, right? Perhaps it was all destiny, you think, as your intestines fall from your stomach and Mrs. Chou cackles over your weakening body.
